D and E.
First click the Test Connector, once it is succeeded then click the Activate checkbox and update.

D and E.

Click Test connector to verify that the MID Server can communicate with the external server host.

After a successful test, select the Active check box and then click Updat

choices.A: Assign a MID Server to the connector

questions.question_text: What two key steps must be performed after creating a new connector instance? (Choose two.)

A customer informs you that they already have monitoring and event management tools.
Which of the following describes the extra value that ServiceNow Event Management provides? (Choose four.)

discussion.content: Can you fix the last answer. Appears it should be a question

choices.A: ServiceNow Event Management Alerts, Incidents, Problems, and changes are automatically correlated with CIs and Business Services that can be visualized in Business Service maps.
choices.B: ServiceNow Event Management manages relationships between alerts and related incidents to maintain an end-to-end event management lifecycle.
choices.C: ServiceNow Event Management provides a business-centric platform and single system of record for service monitoring and remediation results, to better control and manage performance and availability.
choices.D: ServiceNow Event Management provides state-of-the-art performance monitoring capabilities across a wide array of different types of infrastructures.
choices.E: ServiceNow Event Management utilizes the power of MID Servers provide important functions in your ITOM Health deployment. What does MID stand for? A. Management, Instrumentation. and Discovery B. Messaging. Integration, and Data C. Monitoring. Insight. and Domain D. Maintenance, Information, and Distribution with leading monitoring systems to automatically create actionable alerts.

questions.question_text: What would be the primary use case for creating Javascripts in Event Management?

choices.A: To create a customized pull connector to retrieve events on behalf of an event source
choices.B: To automatically populate the Configuration Management Database (CMDB)
choices.C: To parse a nodename out of your raw event data in an event rule
choices.D: To run as part of a remediation workflow for IT alerts that fail to execute

comments.content: C is INCORRECT, to parse a nodename it should be using the regular expression

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct one is A

Selected Answer: A
you can overide the source values in Transform and Compose

Selected Answer: A
A. Transform and Compose Alert Output lab
Correct answer is A because in transform and compose alert output tab we select what data to populate in new alert record.

Selected Answer: A
Mapping for alert fields is in Transform and Compose Alert Output lab.
In event rule info tab is a source field to match the event by, changing the value there would achieve nothing, because that needs to stay unchanged.

choices.A: Transform and Compose Alert Output lab

questions.question_text: You have an event with a Source of ‘Trap from Enterprise 111’, but the alert created for this event shows a Source of ‘Oracle EM’. If you want to change what this is set to, where in the event rule would you do this?

discussion.content:
